newsitem.title: USA: U.S. West Coast diesel prices ease on weak demand.
newsitem.headline: U.S. West Coast diesel prices ease on weak demand.

text.p: U.S. West Coast spot diesel fuel prices on Tuesday continued to ease on weak demand as floodwaters began to recede in some areas of northern California, traders said.
Sellers refused to come off asking prices pushed higher by yesterday's futures rally, and buyers that fled to the sidelines during the run-up patiently waited for cash prices to ease, traders said.

"Sellers are not coming down, and buyers are looking for lower prices in line with the Merc," one trader said, referring to a nearly 1.50 cent a gallon drop in front-month heating oil and more than 0.50 cent a gallon drop in gasoline futures in afternoon NYMEX trade.
With vast areas of farmland and hundreds of homes still under water in northern and central California from recent rains, spot demand for refined products remained weak, traders said.
"Demand in the Bay Area is dead," one trader said.

Traders also were looking for trading signals from weekly inventory figures due out today. "(The market is) fairly quiet, waiting for inventories," one trader said of the American Petroleum Institute report due late in the day.
